The CTAG shall be chaired by a Commission representative
The secretariat shall be provided by the Commission
The CTAG shall draw up its rules of procedure
The rules of procedure shall be made public
Member States may levy a fee for activities set out in this Regulation
The level of fees must be set transparently based on cost recovery principles
Member States may establish reduced fees for non-commercial clinical trials
Member States shall not require multiple payments to different bodies for an assessment
The Commission shall have power to adopt delegated acts
Delegated acts power shall be conferred for 5 years
Commission shall draw up a report on delegated powers 6 months before end of period
Delegation of powers may be tacitly extended for identical periods
European Parliament or Council may oppose extension 3 months before end of period
Delegation of power may be revoked at any time by European Parliament or Council
Commission shall notify delegated acts to European Parliament and Council
Delegated acts must not be objected to by European Parliament or Council within 2 months to enter force
The 2-month objection period may be extended by 2 months at initiative of European Parliament or Council
Member States shall communicate national laws on restricted cell types to the Commission
Gene therapy clinical trials modifying germ line genetic identity are prohibited
National laws may restrict use of specific human or animal cells in medicinal products
National laws may restrict medicinal products used as abortifacients
National laws may restrict medicinal products containing narcotic substances
This Regulation shall not prejudice Council Directive 97/43/Euratom
This Regulation shall not prejudice Council Directive 96/29/Euratom
This Regulation shall not prejudice Directive 2001/18/EC on genetically modified organisms
This Regulation shall not prejudice Directive 2004/23/EC on quality and safety standards
This Regulation shall not prejudice Directive 2002/98/EC
This Regulation shall not prejudice Directive 2010/53/EC
This Regulation shall not prejudice Directive 2009/41/EC
Costs for investigational medicinal products shall not be borne by the subject
Costs for auxiliary medicinal products shall not be borne by the subject
Costs for medical devices used to administer investigational products shall not be borne by the subject
Costs for procedures required by the protocol shall not be borne by the subject
Member States may provide laws allowing subjects to bear some clinical trial costs
Member States shall apply Directive 95/46/EC to personal data processing
Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 shall apply to Commission and Agency data processing
Member States shall establish penalties for infringements of this Regulation
Penalties shall be effective, proportionate and dissuasive
Penalties shall address non-compliance with public information submission requirements
Penalties shall address non-compliance with subject safety provisions
Directive 2001/20/EC is repealed as of the date in Article 99
The Commission shall present a report every 5 years on the application of this Regulation
The report must include an assessment of the Regulation's impact on scientific and technological progress
The report must include information on different types of clinical trials authorized under this Regulation
The Commission may present a legislative proposal to update the Regulation based on the report
Clinical trials authorized under Directive 2001/20/EC shall continue to be governed by that Directive for 3 years
Clinical trials started within 18 months of notice publication may follow Directive 2001/20/EC Articles 6, 7 and 9
Clinical trials must continue to be governed by Directive 2001/20/EC until 42 months after notice publication
The Regulation shall enter into force 20 days after publication in the Official Journal
The Regulation shall apply 6 months after publication of the Article 82(3) notice
The Regulation shall not apply earlier than 28 May 2016
The Regulation shall be binding and directly applicable in all Member States
Sponsors should refer to previous applications where appropriate
Submit written agreement from other sponsor if using data from their trial
Submit detailed responsibilities of each sponsor for multi-sponsor trials
Application must be signed by sponsor or sponsor's representative
Sponsor signature confirms information provided is complete
Sponsor signature confirms attached documents are accurate
Sponsor signature confirms trial will be conducted per protocol
Sponsor signature confirms trial will comply with this Regulation
Cover letter must specify EU trial number and universal trial number
Cover letter must specify if trial involves subjects unable to give informed consent
Cover letter must indicate if trial is first administration of new active substance to humans
Cover letter must state if scientific advice was given on the trial or investigational product
Cover letter must specify if trial is part of a Paediatric Investigation Plan
Cover letter must indicate if products are narcotic, psychotropic or radiopharmaceutical
Cover letter must state if products contain genetically-modified organisms
Cover letter must include comprehensive list of all investigational and auxiliary medicinal products
The cover letter must indicate where information listed in paragraph 7 is contained in the application dossier
The cover letter must indicate if the trial is considered a low-intervention clinical trial by the sponsor
Detailed justification must be provided for classifying a trial as low-intervention
The cover letter must indicate if groups rather than individuals are allocated to receive different investigational products
The cover letter must indicate if informed consent will be obtained by simplified means
The cover letter must indicate the location of reference safety information in the application dossier
For resubmissions, the cover letter must specify the EU trial number for the previous application
For resubmissions, the cover letter must highlight changes compared to the previous submission
The protocol shall describe the objective of the clinical trial
The protocol shall describe the design of the clinical trial
The protocol shall describe the methodology of the clinical trial
The protocol shall describe the statistical considerations of the clinical trial
The protocol shall be identified by the title of the clinical trial
The protocol shall be identified by the EU trial number
The protocol shall be written in an easily accessible and searchable format when possible
Summarize known and potential risks and benefits of the clinical trial
Evaluate anticipated benefits and risks to allow assessment per Article 6
Document scientific grounds for expected clinical benefit in emergency trials
Describe patient involvement in clinical trial design, if applicable
Describe and justify dosage, regime, administration, and treatment period
State if investigational and auxiliary medicinal products are authorized
Justify use of non-authorized auxiliary medicinal products if applicable
Include references to literature and data relevant to the clinical trial
Discuss the relevance of the clinical trial for assessment
Describe the type and design of clinical trial to be conducted
Specify the primary and secondary endpoints to be measured
Describe measures taken to minimize bias, including randomization and blinding
Define the end of the clinical trial clearly and unambiguously
Describe criteria for discontinuing parts or all of the clinical trial
Describe procedures for identifying data to be recorded directly on Case Report Forms as source data
Describe arrangements for collecting, storing and future use of biological samples from trial subjects
Describe arrangements for tracing, storing, destroying and returning investigational medicinal product
Describe statistical methods to be employed in the trial
Specify timing of planned interim analyses and number of subjects to be enrolled
Provide reasons for choice of sample size
Describe subject inclusion and exclusion criteria
Describe procedures for withdrawing subjects from the clinical trial
Describe procedures for collecting data from withdrawn subjects
Describe procedures for replacing withdrawn subjects
Describe follow-up procedures for withdrawn subjects
Justify inclusion of subjects incapable of giving informed consent
Justify gender and age allocation of subjects
Explain reasons for excluding specific gender or age groups
Describe recruitment and informed consent procedures in detail
Describe arrangements for subject care after trial participation ends
Specify efficacy and safety parameters to be assessed
Describe methods and timing for assessing trial parameters
Describe ethical considerations related to the trial
Sponsor must confirm investigators will permit trial monitoring and audits
Describe the publication policy for trial results
Describe arrangements to protect personal data
Describe measures to ensure confidentiality of subject records and personal data
Describe measures to mitigate effects of data security breaches
Protocol may define treatment by active substance or ATC code instead of trade names
Protocol must identify categories of adverse events critical to safety evaluations
Protocol must identify serious adverse events not requiring immediate reporting
Protocol must describe procedures for recording adverse events
Protocol must describe procedures for reporting relevant adverse events to sponsor
Sponsors must report suspected unexpected serious adverse reactions to the Eudravigilance database
Follow-up of subjects after adverse reactions must be conducted
The protocol must indicate reasons for submitting a single safety report on all investigational medicinal products
The protocol shall address labelling and unblinding of investigational medicinal products where necessary
The protocol shall be accompanied by the Charter of the Data Safety Monitoring Committee, if applicable
The protocol shall be accompanied by a synopsis of the protocol
An Investigator's Brochure must be submitted in accordance with scientific knowledge and international guidance
The IB shall enable clinicians to make an unbiased risk-benefit assessment of the trial
The IB shall be prepared from all available information supporting the trial rationale
The IB shall be presented in the form of summaries
The approved SmPC shall be used as the IB for authorized medicinal products
The SmPC shall be supplemented if trial conditions differ from authorized use
The sponsor shall select one SmPC as the IB for trials using only the active substance
Use one SmPC best suited to ensure patient safety for the whole clinical trial
Include a clearly identifiable 'Reference Safety Information' (RSI) section if IB is not an SmPC
RSI must contain product information on the investigational medicinal product
RSI must describe how to determine expected adverse reactions
RSI must include frequency and nature of expected adverse reactions
No GMP documentation needed for authorized, unmodified investigational products manufactured in EU
Submit authorization copy for non-authorized investigational products not manufactured in EU
The qualified person in the Union must certify that manufacturing complies with GMP equivalent to Union GMP
Submit a copy of the authorization referred to in Article 61 for cases not covered by mutual recognition agreements
Submit documentation demonstrating compliance with Article 61(6) requirements for processes under Article 61(5)
The IMPD shall provide information on quality, manufacture, control, and data for investigational medicinal products
The IMPD may be replaced by other documentation with a simplified IMPD
Each IMPD section must have a detailed table of contents
Each IMPD section must have a glossary of terms
The IMPD information shall be concise
The IMPD must not be unnecessarily voluminous
Present IMPD data in tabular form where possible
Include brief narrative highlighting main points in IMPD
Submit quality data in ICH Common Technical Document Module 3 format
IMPD shall contain summaries of non-clinical pharmacology and toxicology data
Include reference list of studies and literature references in IMPD
The IMPD shall contain a statement of the good laboratory practice status or equivalent standards
Test material used in toxicity studies must be representative of clinical trial material
Preparation of test material shall be subject to controls to ensure validity of the study
Data from previous clinical trials shall be submitted in a logical structure
Summaries of all available data from previous trials and human experience shall be provided
A statement of compliance with good clinical practice for previous trials shall be included
An integrated summary analyzing non-clinical and clinical data in relation to risks/benefits shall be provided
Cross-reference relevant protocol sections if information is already provided there
Identify any studies that were terminated prematurely
Discuss reasons for premature study termination
Evaluate foreseeable risks for studies on minors or incapacitated adults
Discuss safety margins in terms of systemic exposure (AUC or Cmax)
Discuss clinical relevance of findings from non-clinical and clinical studies
Provide recommendations for further monitoring of effects and safety
Clinical information shall include data providing sufficient detail for assessors to evaluate toxicity and safety
Clinical data should preferably be provided in tables
Detailed expert explanations beyond the IB must be submitted as part of the IMPD
The current SmPC version may be submitted as the IMPD for authorized investigational medicinal products
New data provided should be clearly identified
The simplified IMPD content requirements are detailed in Table 1
Provide SmPC, P, and A data for authorized investigational medicinal products supplied by the marketing authorization holder
Submit SmPC, P, and A data for unauthorized investigational medicinal products with active substance in authorized products
Include SmPC, S, P, and A data when investigational product is supplied by a different manufacturer
Reference previous submission for previously authorized investigational products with no new data
Submit new data for previously authorized investigational products with updated information
Provide appropriate data when using previously authorized products under different conditions
Use representative SmPC for products defined by active substance or ATC code in protocol
Provide collated document with information equivalent to representative SmPCs for each active substance
Limit information requirements for placebos to quality data
No additional documentation required if placebo has same composition as tested IMP except active substance
Apply documentation requirements for IMPs to auxiliary medicinal products
Submit copy of summary of scientific advice if available
Submit copy of Agency's decision on PIP agreement if trial is part of agreed PIP
Submit documents not fully accessible via internet
Provide link to internet-accessible documents in cover letter
Provide description of investigational medicinal product labelling content
Describe subject inclusion procedures in detail if not in protocol
Indicate clearly what the first act of recruitment is
Submit copies of advertising materials used for subject recruitment
Outline procedures for handling responses to recruitment advertisements
Submit all information given to subjects before participation with the informed consent form
Describe procedures for obtaining informed consent from legally designated representatives of minors
Describe procedures for involving minors or incapacitated subjects in the consent process
Provide information on using and selecting impartial witnesses for consent procedures
Describe procedures for obtaining consent in emergency clinical trials
Describe procedures to identify and document urgency in emergency clinical trials
Describe simplified means for obtaining informed consent in group-allocated trials
Submit information given to subjects and legally designated representatives
Submit list of planned clinical trial sites
Submit names and positions of principal investigators
Submit planned number of subjects at each site
Submit current CVs and qualifications of investigators
Describe investigators' training in good clinical practice principles
Present any conditions that might influence investigator impartiality
Submit a written statement on suitability of clinical trial sites
Submit proof of insurance or indemnification if applicable
Provide a brief description of clinical trial financing
Submit information on financial compensation to subjects and investigators
Describe any other agreements between sponsor and site
Submit proof of fee payment if applicable
Provide statement that data will comply with EU data protection laws
Sponsors may submit a single request for authorization of a substantial modification across multiple trials
Cover letter must list all clinical trials related to the substantial modification application
Application must be signed by the sponsor or sponsor's representative
Sponsor's signature confirms the information provided is complete
Sponsor's signature confirms attached documents accurately reflect available information
Sponsor's signature confirms trial will be conducted according to amended documentation
Cover letter subject line must include the EU trial number and substantial modification code number
Cover letter must identify the applicant
Identify the substantial modification with a code number and date
Highlight special issues relating to the modification
Indicate where relevant information is located in the original application dossier
Identify information not in the form that might impact subject risk
List all clinical trials being substantially modified with EU trial numbers
Present modifications with track changes showing previous and new wording
Provide a new version of the entire document for widespread changes
New document versions shall be identified by date and updated version number
Supporting information shall include summaries of data
Supporting information shall include an updated overall risk/benefit assessment
Supporting information shall include possible consequences for subjects in the trial
Supporting information shall include possible consequences for evaluation of results
Supporting information shall include documents related to changes in subject information
Supporting information shall include justification for substantial modification changes
Proof of payment shall be submitted if applicable
Investigators do not need to actively monitor subjects for adverse events after trial end
Sponsors must report SUSARs to the Agency in accordance with Article 42
Medication errors must be reported as adverse reactions
Pregnancies must be reported as adverse reactions
Uses outside protocol must be reported as adverse reactions
Sponsors must consult reporting investigator if causality information is missing
Sponsors must not downgrade investigator's causality assessment
Both sponsor and investigator opinions must be provided if disagreement on causality
Consider if an adverse event adds significant information on specificity, occurrence, or severity of a known reaction
The sponsor shall set out the expectedness of an adverse reaction in the Reference Safety Information (RSI)
Determine expectedness based on events previously observed with the active substance
Include the RSI in the SmPC or the Investigator's Brochure
Refer to the RSI location in the application dossier cover letter
Select the most appropriate SmPC for RSI if authorized in multiple Member States
Use the RSI version at the time of SUSAR occurrence for reporting
Consider expectedness information provided by the reporting investigator
SUSAR reports must include a valid EU trial number
SUSAR reports must include an identifiable coded subject
SUSAR reports must include a causality assessment
SUSAR reports must include the sender's safety report unique identifier
SUSAR reports must include the worldwide unique case identification number
Sponsors must submit completed reports of fatal/life-threatening SUSARs within 15 days
Initial SUSAR reporting clock starts when minimum reporting criteria are received
Report significant new information on an already reported case within 15 days as a follow-up report
Submit follow-up report within 7 days for SUSARs that become fatal/life-threatening
Submit completed report within 8 additional days for SUSARs that become fatal/life-threatening
Create combined report if SUSAR becomes fatal/life-threatening before initial report submitted
Investigator shall only unblind treatment allocation if relevant to subject safety
Sponsor shall only unblind treatment allocation of affected subject when reporting SUSAR
Sponsor shall break the blind only for the subject with a potential SUSAR
Maintain unblinded information for persons responsible for ongoing trial conduct
Restrict unblinded information access to those involved in safety reporting to the Agency
Allow Data Safety Monitoring Boards access to unblinded information
Highlight disease-related serious events not subject to unblinding in the protocol
Apply SUSAR reporting rules if an unblinded event is determined to be a SUSAR
Include the Reference Safety Information in effect at the start of the reporting period
The RSI in effect at the start of the reporting period shall serve as RSI during the reporting period
Significant changes to the RSI during the reporting period shall be listed in the annual safety report
The revised RSI shall be submitted as an appendix to the annual safety report
The summary of clinical trial results shall contain the trial identification
The summary shall include trial identifiers such as EU trial number
The summary shall include sponsor details with scientific and public contact points
The summary shall include paediatric regulatory details if applicable
The summary shall include the result analysis stage information
Include the date of global end of the clinical trial in the summary of results
Indicate identified concerns related to efficacy for trials on authorized products
Include general information about the clinical trial objectives and design
Report actual number of subjects included in the trial by location
Provide age group and gender breakdown of trial subjects
Include recruitment information on number of subjects screened, recruited and withdrawn
Report baseline characteristics of age and gender for trial subjects
Provide information for all endpoints defined in the protocol
Include adverse events information in the report
Report serious adverse events separately from non-serious events
Document global substantial modifications to the trial
Report global interruptions and re-starts of the trial
Address sources of potential bias and imprecisions in the report
Include a declaration on the accuracy of the submitted information
Include name, address and phone number of main contact on packaging
List substance name and strength/potency on packaging
For blind trials, list substance name with comparator/placebo name on both products
Include pharmaceutical form on packaging
List route of administration on packaging
Specify quantity of dosage units on packaging
Label must include batch or code number identifying contents and packaging operation
Label must include clinical trial reference code for trial identification
Label must include subject identification number and/or treatment number
Label must include 'For clinical trial use only' or similar wording
Label must include storage conditions
Label must include expiry date in month/year format that avoids ambiguity
Label must include 'Keep out of reach of children' except for in-clinic trials
Symbols or pictograms may be included to clarify label information
The name of the main contact must appear on the immediate packaging
The pharmaceutical form must appear on the immediate packaging
The route of administration must appear on the immediate packaging
The quantity of dosage units must appear on the immediate packaging
The batch/code number identifying contents and packaging must appear on immediate packaging
A clinical trial reference code must appear on the immediate packaging
The subject identification number must appear on the immediate packaging
The period of use must appear on the immediate packaging in month/year format
The immediate packaging must contain the name of the main contact
The immediate packaging must contain the route of administration
The immediate packaging must contain the batch or code number
The immediate packaging must contain a clinical trial reference code
The immediate packaging must contain the subject identification number
The immediate packaging must contain the period of use (expiry or re-test date)
Unauthorised auxiliary medicinal products must be labeled with specific particulars
The label must include 'For clinical trial use only' or similar wording
The label must include the storage conditions
The label must include the period of use (expiry date or retest date)
The label must include the name of the main contact
The label must include the clinical trial reference code
Some label information may be provided by other means if justified in the protocol
Certain critical label information must not be omitted from the product label
Article 1 and Article 2(1) and (2) points (1), (2) and (4) of this Regulation correlate to Article 1(1) of Directive 2001/20/EC
Article 2(2) point (30) of this Regulation correlates to Article 1(2) of Directive 2001/20/EC
Article 47, third subparagraph of this Regulation correlates to Article 1(3), second subparagraph of Directive 2001/20/EC
Article 47, second subparagraph of this Regulation correlates to Article 1(4) of Directive 2001/20/EC
Articles 4, 28, 29 and 76 of this Regulation correlate to Article 3(2) of Directive 2001/20/EC
